TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND INTRODUCE A RESOLUTION INSTRUCTING THE COMMITTEE ON JUDICIARY TO REPORT A BILL DECLARING WHO SHALL CALL CONVENTIONS FOR THE REORGANIZATION OF REBEL STATES, AND FURTHER PROVIDING THAT ALL ELECTIONS FOR MEMBERS OF SAID CONVENTIONS OR FOR CHOICE OF PUBLIC OFFICES, STATE AND MUNICIPAL SHALL BE BY BALLOT, UNTIL CONSTITUTIONS OF SAID STATES SHALL HAVE BEEN APPROVED BY CONGRESS.

TO TABLE A RESOLUTION REQUESTING THE SPEAKER TO APPOINT A JUDICIARY COMMITTEE AND DIRECT SAID COMMITTEE TO TAKE CHARGE OF THE TESTIMONY TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE OF THE LAST CONGRESS FOR THE IMPEACHMENT OF THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES AND GRANTING SAID COMMITTEE POWER TO APPOINT A CLERK AT A COMPENSATION NOT TO EXCEED SIX DOLLARS PER DAY AND TO EMPLOY THE NECESSARY STENOGRAPHERS.
TO PASS H. R. 2, A BILL REPEALING AN ACT ENTITLED 'AN ACT TO RETROCEDE THE COUNTY OF ALEXANDRIA, IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, TO THE STATE OF VIRGINIA AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES'.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND INTRODUCE A RESOLUTION EXTENDING THE SYMPATHY OF THE HOUSE TO THE PEOPLE OF IRELAND IN THEIR PENDING STRUGGLE FOR CONSTITUTIONAL LIBERTY.
TO REFER A RESOLUTION EXTENDING SYMPATHY TO IRELAND TO THE COMMITTEE ON FOREIGN AFFAIRS.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND INTRODUCE A RESOLUTION DIRECTING THE CONTINUING OF THE JOINT COMMITTEE ON RECONSTRUCTION.

TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH H. R. 31 WAS ORDERED TO BE ENGROSSED AND READ A THIRD TIME.

TO TABLE H.R. 33, (15 STAT 2, MAR. 23, 1867) A BILL SUPPLEMENTARY TO AN ACT ENTITLED 'AN ACT TO PROVIDE FOR THE MORE EFFICIENT GOVERNMENT OF THE REBEL STATES' PASSED MARCH 2, 1867, AND TO FACILITATE RESTORATION.
TO PASS H. R. 33.

TO PASS H.J.RES. 8, (15 STAT 353, MAR. 30, 1867) A RESOLUTION DIRECTING THE SECRETARY OF INTERIOR TO SUSPEND EXECUTION OF A LAW PASSED BY THE 39TH CONGRESS FOR THE RELIEF OF HEIRS OF JOHN E. BOULIGNY.

TO POSTPONE FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF A RESOLUTION DIRECTING THAT THE COMMITTEE ON MILITARY AFFAIRS BE APPOINTED AND AUTHORIZED TO SIT DURING THE RECESS FOR THE PURPOSE OF INQUIRING INTO THE MANNER OF PROCURING HEAVY ORDINANCY FOR THE UNITED SERVICES, THE DISBURSEMENTS RELATING, THERETO, AND THE QUALITY OF THE RIFLES AND SMOOTHBORE GUNS HERETOFORE INTRODUCED AND HEREAFTER TO BE INTRODUCED INTO SAID SERVICE UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY OF DECEMBER NEXT.
TO TABLE A RESOLUTION REGARDING GOVERNMENT ORDINANCE.

TO TABLE A RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT ALL BOOKS AND PUBLIC DOCUMENTS EXCEPT THE CONGRESSIONAL GLOBE, OF WHICH EXTRA COPIES HAVE BEEN ORDERED PRINTED FOR DISTRIBUTION, SHALL NOW BE DELIVERED BY OFFICERS HAVING POSSESSION OF SAME TO THE REPRESENTATIVES IN THIS HOUSE OF THOSE DISTRICTS WHERE FORMER REPRESENTATIVES HAVE NOT DRAWN THE DOCUMENTS TO WHICH SUCH DISTRICTS WERE RESPECTIVELY ENTITLED ACCORDING TO THE RATES OF DISTRIBUTION.
TO PASS THE BOOKS AND PUBLIC DOCUMENTS RESOLUTION.

TO AMEND THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 33, STRIKING OUT 'CAST AT SAID ELECTION' (AT LEAST 1/2 OF ALL REGISTERED VOTERS VOTING UPON THE QUESTION ON SUCH RATIFICATION) IN SECTION FIVE, PAGE 10, 11. 3-5; SO THAT IT WILL READ: (SECT. FIVE) 'AND BE IT FURTHER ENACTED THAT IF ACCORDING TO SAID RETURNS, THE CONSTITUTION SHALL BE RATIFIED BY A MAJORITY OF THE VOTES OF ELECTORS QUALIFIED AS HEREIN SPECIFIED, THE PRESIDENT OF THE CONVENTION SHALL TRANSMIT A COPY OF SAME, DULY CERTIFIED, TO THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES WHO SHALL FORTHWITH TRANSMIT SAME TO CONGRESS, IF THEN IN SESSION, AND IF NOT IN SESSION, THEN IMMEDIATELY UPON ITS NEXT ASSEMBLING.
TO PASS S. J. RES. 26, (15 STAT 21, 3/22/1867) A RESOLUTION PROVIDING FOR THE NECESSARY SURVEYS FOR A SHIP CANAL BETWEEN LAKE ERIE AND LAKE ONTARIO FOR MILITARY, NAVAL AND COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND INTRODUCE A JOINT RESOLUTION DIRECTING THE SECRETARY OF WAR TO DISSOLVE ALL COMMISSIONS APPOINTED AND TO PAY COMMISSIONERS AND CLERKS FOR SERVICE RENDERED IN MAKING REPORT OF THEIR PROCEEDINGS TO WAR DEPARTMENT.
TO PASS H. J. RES. 21, (15 STAT 25, MAR. 29, 1867) A RESOLUTION RELATING TO THE ISSUE OF AGRICULTURAL COLLEGE SCRIP TO THE STATE LATELY IN REBELLION.
TO TABLE H. R. 73, AN ACT TO EXEMPT LADDERS FROM INTERNAL TAX.
TO RECEDE FROM THE SECOND AND THIRD AMENDMENTS BY THE HOUSE TO THE SENATE'S AMENDMENT TO H. R. 33.

TO TABLE THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H. R. 33, EMPOWERING CONGRESS TO DETERMINE AN ELECTION, AND TO DECIDE WHETHER THE ELECTION WAS A FAIR ONE, CONDUCTED IN A MANNER PERMITTING EVERY PERSON TO VOTE IF ENTITLED TO DO SO AND IF THE CONSTITUTION IS ONE WHICH MEETS THE APPROVAL OF A MAJORITY OF ALL THE ELECTORS OF THE STATE.

TO AMEND A RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT A. C. HUNT, ESQ., IS PRIMA FACIE ENTITLED TO THE SEAT IN THE HOUSE AS A DELEGATE FROM THE TERRITORY OF COLORADO, PENDING THE CONTEST OF HIS RIGHT TO THE SAME BY GEORGE M. CHILCOTT, ESQ.; BY SWEARING IN GEORGE M. CHILCOTT AS THE SITTING DELEGATE FROM THE TERRITORY OF COLORADO PENDING ACTION OF THE COMMITTEE AND HOUSE.

TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING DISCUSSION OF CONSIDERATION OF THE S. J. RES. 16, (15 STAT 28, 3/30/1867) A RESOLUTION PROVIDING FOR RELIEF OF THE SESTITUTE OF SOUTHERN AND SOUTHWESTERN STATES.  (SPEEKER VOTED IN THE NEGATIVE.)
TO RESOLVE THE HOUSE INTO COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE ON STATE OF THE UNION TO CONSIDER S. J. RES. 16.

TO RESOLVE THE HOUSE INTO COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE AND PROCEED TO CONSIDER S. J. RES. 16.
TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF S. J. RES. 16.
TO ADJOURN MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF S. J. RES. 16. 6

TO AMEND H.R. 72, (15 STAT 6, MAR. 26, 1867) A BILL TAXING WRAPPING PAPER, BY EXEMPTING CERTAIN TYPES FROM INTERNAL TAX.

TO AMEND S. J. RES. 19, (15 STAT 28, MAR. 30, 1867) A RESOLUTION DIRECTING THE SECRETARY OF WAR TO FINISH CERTAIN ARMS AND EQUIPMENT TO THE STATE OF TENNESSEE; BY PROVIDING ARMS AND EQUIPMENT SUFFICIENT FOR 10,000 MILITIA INSTEAD OF 2,500.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND IMMEDIATELY REMOVE HENRY A. SMYTHE AS COLLECTOR OR PORT OF NEW YORK AND TO HAVE THE CLERK OF THE HOUSE CAUSE A CERTIFIED COPY OF THIS RESOLUTION TO BE LAID BEFORE THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO OVERRIDE VETO ON H. R. 33.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION FIXING THE DAY FOR ADJOURNMENT AND REASSEMBLING OF CONGRESS.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION CONCERNING ADJOURNMENT OF CONGRESS.
TO ADJOURN MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION THE RESOLUTION CONCERNING ADJOURNMENT OF CONGRESS.
TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION CONCERNING ADJOURNMENT OF CONGRESS.

TO PASS A RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT THE SENATE AND THE HOUSE OF REPRESENATIVES SHALL ADJOURN THE PRESENT SESSION 12 O'CLOCK THURSDAY NEXT, MARCH 28, TO ASSEMBLE AGAIN ON FIRST WEDNESDAY OF SEPTEMBER AND FIRST WEDNESDAY OF NOVEMBER OF THIS YEAR, UNLESS BY JOINT PROCLAMATION ISSUED 10 DAYS BEFORE ABOVE FIXED TIMES SPEAKER AND PRESIDENT PRO TEMPORE DECLARE NO OCCASION FOR MEETING OF CONGRESS AT SUCH TIME.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PROVIDE FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF THE COMMITTEE ON PUBLIC EXPENDITURES TO CONTINUE INVESTIGATION INTO THE CONDUCT OF HENRY A. SMYTHE, A COLLECTOR AT THE PORT OF NEW YORK, GRANTING PERMISSION TO HENRY A. SMYTHE TO APPEAR BY COUNSEL BEFORE SAID COMMITTEE IN DEFENSE OF HIS CONDUCT AS SAID COLLECTOR.

TO AMEND THE ADJOURNMENT OF CONGRESS RESOLUTION BY FIXING THE DATE FOR ADJOURNMENT OF PRESENT SESSION AT 12 P.M. THURSDAY MARCH 28; TO RECONVENE ON FIRST WEDNESDAY OF JUNE AND FIRST WEDNESDAY OF SEPTEMBER.

TO AMEND A RESOLUTION EXTENDING SYMPATHY TO THE PEOPLE OF IRELAND AND CANADA IN THEIR STRUGGLES FOR INDEPENDENCE, BY DECLARING THE BELIEF OF CONGRESS TO BE THAT THE PRESENT FENIAN MOVEMENT MUST PROVE ENTIRELY ABORTIVE IN BRINGING RELIEF TO IRELAND, AND THAT ANY ENCOURAGEMENT TO THAT MOVEMENT, UNACCOMPANIED BY FORCE, CAN ONLY RESULT IN INVOLVING IRISHMEN IN DIFFICULTIES FROM WHICH THEIR BRETHERN ARE POWERLESS TO EXTRICATE THEM.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION PROVIDING FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF THE COMMITTEE OF PUBLIC EXPENDITURES TO CONTINUE THE INVESTIGA- TION INTO CONDUCT OF HENRY A. SMYTHE, A COLLECTOR OF THE PORT OF NEW YORK.
TO TABLE A RESOLUTION AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE AND THE SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE TO CLOSE THE PRESENT SESSION ON FRIDAY, MAR. 29TH, AT 12 MIDNIGHT.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION REGARDING ADJOURNMENT OF CONGRESS BY PROVIDING TO ADJOURN ON FRIDAY MAR. 29 AT 3 O'CLOCK P.M. UNTIL WEDNESDAY JUNE 5 NEXT AT 12 O'CLOCK WHEN, UNLESS A QUORUM OF BOTH HOUSES BE PRESENT, SPEAKER AND PRESIDENT OF SENATE FURTHER ADJOURN UNTIL WEDNESDAY SEPT. 4 NEXT AT 12 M., WHEN, UNLESS A QUORUM BE PRESENT, FURTHER ADJOURN UNTIL 1ST MONDAY IN DEC. NEXT.

TO AMEND H. J. RES. 51, (15 STAT 353, MAR. 30, 1867) RELATING TO THE IRON-CLAD MONITOR COMANCHE BY PROVIDING TO PAY $179,000 TO DONAHUE, RYAN, AND SECAR FOR LOSSES SUSTAINED BY THEM IN THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE MONITOR COMANCHE.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND INTRODUCE H. R. 103, A RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT EIGHT HOURS A DAY IS TO CONSTITUTE A DAY'S WORK FOR ALL LABORERS, WORKMEN, AND MECHANICS EMPLOYED BY OR ON BEHALF OF THE GOVERNMENT OF UNITED STATES.
TO TABLE A MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE ENGROSSMENT OF S. 105 FOR THIRD READING.  S. 105 (15 STAT 9, 3/29/1867) RELATES TO OHIO AND INDIANA WAR CLAIMS.
TO PASS S. 105.
TO TABLE A PREAMBLE AND A RESOLUTION REGARDING THE IMPEACHMENT OF THE PRESIDENT AND ADJOURNMENT OF CONGRESS.

TO AMEND THE IMPEACHMENT-ADJOURNMENT RESOLUTION BY PROVIDING FOR ADJOURNMENT OF SENATE AND HOUSE AT 3 P.M. MARCH 30, INSTANT TO 1ST WEDNESDAY IN JULY, 1867, WHEN SPEAKER AND PRESIDENT OF EACH HOUSE CAUSE ROLL TO BE READ, AND IF NO QUORUM PRESENT, TO ADJOURN FROM DAY TO DAY FOR FOUR SUCCESSIVE DAYS, AND IF AT EVERY SUCH CALLING EITHER FOUND WITHOUT QUORUM, SAID SPEAKER AND PRESIDENT ADJOURN THEIR RESPECTIVE HOUSES WITHOUT DAY.
TO TABLE THE IMPEACHMENT-ADJOURNMENT RESOLUTION.

TO CONCUR IN SENATE'S AMENDMENT OF ADJOURNMENT OF CONGRESS RESOLUTION WHICH DIRECTS THE SPEAKER OF HOUSE AND PRESIDENT OF SENATE TO ADJOURN HOUSES ON SATURDAY, MAR. 30, '67 AT 12 M. TO THE FIRST WEDNESDAY JULY '67 AT NOON WHEN ROLL SHALL IMMEDIATELY BE CALLED AN PRESIDING OFFICERS OF EACH HOUSE SHALL CAUSE PRESIDING OFFICER OF OTHER HOUSE WHETHER QUORUM APPEARED AND IF NO QUORUM PRESENT, TO ADJOURN RESPECTIVE HOUSES WITHOUT DAY.
TO PASS H. J. RES. 53, TENDERING THANKS OF CONGRESS TO MAJOR GENERAL PHILIP H. SHERIDAN FOR HIS ABLE AND FAITHFUL PERFORMANCE OF HIS DUTIES AS COMMANDER OF MILITARY DISTRICT OF TEXAS AND LOUISIANA.

TO PASS H. J. RES. 54, TENDERING THANKS OF CONGRESS TO MAJOR GENERAL DANIEL E. SICKLES FOR HIS ABLE AND FAITHFUL PERFORMANCE OF DUTIES OF COMMANDER OF SECOND DISTRICT OF NORTH CAROLINA AND SOUTH CAROLINA.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND CONSIDER A RESOLUTION AND PREAMBLE REQUESTING THE PRESIDENT TO INFORM THE HOUSE WHETHER THE PUBLICATION OF 'AUTHORIZED STATEMENT' OF PRESIDENT OF UNITED STATES AND CABINET RE. AN INTERPRETATION OF RECONSTRUCTION ACTION OF 21ST OF JUNE IN LAST NATIONAL INTELLIGENCER WAS MADE BY HIS AUTHORITY OR WITH HIS KNOWLEDGE OR ASSENT AND ASKING THAT COPY OF SAME BE FURNISHED TO HOUSE.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND CONSIDER A RESOLUTION PROVIDING FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF A SPECIAL COMMITTEE OF FIVE TO INVESTIGATE AND RECORD FACTS RE. ASSASSINATION OF PRESIDENT LINCOLN AND TO GRANT AMNESTY TO PERSONS HAVING KNOWLEDGE OF FACTS IF THEY TESTIFY FULLY AND TRUTHFULLY BEFORE COMMITTEE.

TO PASS THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT IT IS BELIEVED PERSONS HIGH IN OFFICE AND AUTHORITY WERE INVOLVED IN THE ASSASSINATION OF PRESIDENT LINCOLN AND THAT SUCH PERSONS MAY BE PREVENTED FROM GIVING EVIDENCE BECAUSE OF LIABILITY TO PUNISHMENT FOR PARTICIPATION IN THE CONSPIRACY; THEREFORE, IN ORDER TO OPEN ALL SOURCES OF EVIDENCE TENDING TO REVEAL FACTS OF CONSPIRACY, HOUSE BELIEVES THAT NO PERSON IN WHOSE FAVOR SUCH REPORT SHALL BE MADE OUGHT TO BE BROUGHT TO TRIAL AND ANY EVIDENCE GIVEN BY HIM TO COMMITTEE USED AGAINST SUCH PERSON ON ANY TRIAL.

TO PASS H. R. 123, (15 STAT 14, JULY 19, 1867) A BILL SUPPLEMENTARY TO AN ACT ENTITLED 'AN ACT TO PROVIDE FOR THE MORE EFFICIENT GOVERNMENT OF THE REBEL STATES' PASSED MARCH 2, 1867 AND ACT SUPPLEMENTARY THERETO PASSED ON MARCH 23, 1867.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND CONSIDER THE FIRST RESOLUTION INSTITUTING INVESTIGATION OF TREATMENT BY CONFEDERATE AUTHORITIES OF UNION OFFICERS, SOLDIERS AND CITIZENS CAPTURED OR HELD BY THEM DURING REBELLION; APPOINTING A HOUSE COMMITTEE OF FIVE AND GRANTING AMNESTY TO WITNESSES.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION REGARDING TREATMENT OF UNION PRISONERS.

TO PASS A THIRD RESOLUTION REGARDING THE TREATMENT OF UNION PRISONERS, EMPOWERING A COMMITTEE TO REPORT AN ACT OF GRACE AND AMNESTY TO ANY PERSON OR PERSONS HAVING COGNIZANCE OF UNLAWFUL TREATMENT OF UNION OFFICERS, SOLDIERS, SAILORS, MARINES OR CITIZENS BY CONFEDERATE AUTHORITIES.

TO SUSTAIN THE DECISION OF THE CHAIR CONCERNING THE IMPEACHMENT-ADJOURNMENT RESOLUTION; SAID DESISION OVERRULING A POINT OF ORDER SO AS TO NOT RENDER NULL THE CONCURRENT RESOLUTION OF QUORUMS OF BOTH HOUSES; SPEAKER RULED:  1) ADOPTION OF RESOLUTION SANCTIONED PRINCIPLE OF THIS AMENDMENT (WHICH DIRECTS THE SPEAKER TO APPOINT THE JUDICIARY COMMITTEE AND DIRECT SAID COMMITTEE TO TAKE CHARGE OF THE TESTIMONY REGARDING IMPEACHMENT OF THE PRESIDENT TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE OF THE LAST CONGRESS) AND ESTABLISHED PRECEDENT FOR IT; 2) LESS THAN A QUORUM CANNOT SET ASIDE MANNER OF PROCEEDING PROVIDED FOR BY QUORUM 3) RECOGNITION OF SUCH ABSOLUTE POWER WOULD ENABLE LESS THAN QUORUM, AND WHEN NO QUORUM PRESENT, TO CONTINUE THE SESSION AGAINST THE DECLARED WISHES OF A QUORUM OF THE TWO HOUSES.
TO AMEND THE IMPEACHMENT- ADJOURNMENT RESOLUTION BY PROVIDING FOR ADJOURNMENT UNTIL NOVEMBER 13 INSTEAD OF OCTOBER 16.

TO AMEND A RESOLUTION RELATING TO IMPEACHMENT-AND RESOLUTION, BY DIRECTING THE PRESIDING OFFICERS OF BOTH HOUSES TO ADJOURN TO OCTOBER 16, 1867 AT 12 M. AND IMMEDIATELY AFTER ROLL CALL PRESIDING OFFICER OF ONE HOUSE INFORM THE OTHER WHETHER A QUORUM APPEARED THEREUPON, AND IF NOT, ADJOURN THEIR RESPECTIVE HOUSES WITH DAY.

TO PASS A RESOLUTION AND PREAMBLE PROVIDING THAT WHEREAS GEO. T. BLAKELY ASKED FOR ADMISSION TO THIS HOUSE AS A REPRESENTATIVE FROM THIRD DISTRICT OF KENTUCKY, AND HIS COMPETITION ELIJAH HISE HAVING DIED BEFORE THE VOTES WERE CANVASSED, AND NO OTHER PERSON CLAIMS A SEAT AS A REPRESENTATIVE OF SAID DISTRICT, THIS CASE IS NOT PROVIDED FOR BY ANY STATUTE OF UNITED STATES, BUT SUBJECT TO PROVISIONS OF CONSTITUTION.  THEREFORE, RESOLVED, THAT IN THIS CASE TRANSCRIPTS OF OFFICIAL RECORDS OR FILES AND EXTRACTS THEREFROM DULY CERTIFIED UNDER SEAL BY CLERKS OF COUNTY COURTS IN SAID DISTRICT SHALL BE COMPETENT EVIDENCE BEFORE THE COMMITTEE ON ELECTIONS AND BEFORE THIS HOUSE OF FACTS SHOWN.

TO PASS A RESOLUTION DIRECTING THE SPEAKER TO APPOINT THE JUDICIARY COMMITTEE AND DIRECT SAID COMMITTEE TO TAKE CHARGE OF THE IMPEACHMENT OF THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES TESTIMONY TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE OF THE LAST CONGRESS.

TO SUSPEND RULES AND CONSIDER A RESOLUTION REGARDING LANDS GRANTED TO AID IN CONSTRUCTION OF SOUTHERN RAILROADS; DECLARING FORFEITED TO UNITED STATES ALL LANDS GRANTED BY CONGRESS IN 1856, WHICH GRANTS EXPIRED BY LIMITATIONS.
TO SUSPEND RULES AND ALLOW FIVE MINUTES DEBATE ON AMENDMENTS OFFERED OR PENDING ON H. R. 123.

TO AGREE TO SENATE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 123, WHICH FURTHER ENACTS, 'THAT NO DISTRICT COMMANDER OR MEMBER OF BOARD OF REGISTRATION OR ANY OFFICERS OR APPOINTEES ACTING UNDER THEM SHALL BE BOUND IN THEIR ACTION BY ANY OPINION OF ANY OFFICER OF UNITED STATES.
TO CALL ROLL OF HOUSE MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF H. J. RES. 70, A RESOLUTION EXPLAINING THE CONCLUDING PROVISO OF SECTION 10, CHAPTER 67 OF LAWS OF 39TH CONGRESS, PASSED MARCH 2, 1867.

TO PASS A RESOLUTION THAT THE HOUSE WILL ENTERTAIN NO RESOLUTION WHICH IMPLIES OTHER THAN THE MOST TENDER AND HUMANE TREATMENT OF REBEL PRISONERS UNLESS SUCH RESOLUTION IS ACCOMPANIED BY A RESPONSIBLE CHARGE THAT THEY WERE TREATED OTHERWISE.
TO ADOPT REPORT OF COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE ON H. R. 123.

TO PASS H. J. RES. 72, AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF TREASURY TO CAUSE CERTAIN MUSTER-OUT ROLLS TO BE PHOTOGRAPHED:  AND FIXING A FINE NOT EXCEEDING $1000 OR NOT MORE THAN SIX MONTHS IMPRISONMENT FOR ANY OFFICER OR EMPLOYEE OF THE GOVERNMENT WHO SHALL BE FOUND GUILTY IN GIVING PREFERENCE TO SUCH CLAIM.
TO RECESS UNTIL 5 O'CLOCK, MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF A RESOLUTION FIXING THE TIME FOR ADJOURNMENT AND REASSEMBLING OF CONGRESS.
TO PASS H. J. RES. 71, (15 STAT 30, JULY 19, 1867) A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO CARRY INTO EFFECT THE SEVERAL ACTS PROVIDING FOR THE MORE EFFICIENT GOVERNMENT OF THE REBEL STATES.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION INSTRUCTING THE COMMITTEE ON JUDICIARY TO INQUIRE AND REPORT WHETHER THE STATES OF KENTUCKY, MARYLAND, AND DELAWARE, NOW HAVE A REPUBLICAN FORM OF GOVERNMENT.
TO PROVIDE THAT WHEN THE HOUSE ADJOURNS TODAY IT WILL MEET NEXT ON WEDNESDAY.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION ANNOUNCING THE DOCTRINE THAT THE ABROGATION OF THE GOVERNMENTS OF THE REBEL STATES BINDS THE NATION TO PAY THEIR DEBTS INCURRED PRIOR TO THE LATE REBELLION.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND INTRODUCE A RESOLUTION AUTHORIZING THE PAYMENT OF MILEAGE TO MEMBERS OF THE 40TH CONGRESS.
TO PASS S. 137, AN ACT PROVIDING FOR THE FURTHER SECURITY OF EQUAL RIGHTS IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO OVERRIDE PRESIDENT'S VETO OF H. R. 123.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND CONSIDER H. J. RES. 80, PROVIDING THAT NO DISTRICT OR DEPARTMENT COMMANDER SHALL BE RELIEVED FROM THE COMMAND HERETOFORE ASSIGNED TO AND NOW EXERCISED BY HIM WITHOUT THE ADVICE AND CONSENT OF THE SENATE, UNLESS THE CHANGE OF COMMAND BE RECOMMENDED BY THE GENERAL COMMANDING THE ARMY.
TO OVERRIDE PRESIDENT'S VETO OF H. J. RES. 71.
TO CONCUR IN SENATE RESOLUTION ADJOURNING BOTH HOUSES OF CONGRESS AT P.M. JULY 20; TO MEET AGAIN ON FIRST MONDAY OF DECEMBER NEXT.

THAT THE HOUSE RECEDE FROM ADHERENCE TO ITS DISAGREEMENT TO THE SUBSTITUTE OF THE SENATE AND AGREE TO A COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE ON A RESOLUTION TO ADJOURN BOTH HOUSES OF CONGRESS ON JULY 20; TO MEET AGAIN ON NOVEMBER 13 NEXT AT NOON; BOTH HOUSES TO REASSEMBLE WITHOUT FURTHER ORDER.

TO PASS A MODIFIED RESOLUTION INSTRUCTING THE JUDICIARY COMMITTEE TO CAUSE THEIR REPORT ON THE IMPEACHMENT TESTIMONY TO BE PRINTED AND PRESENTED WHEN THEY PRESENT THE TESTIMONY ON THE PRESIDENT'S IMPEACHMENT IN THE FIRST WEEK OF THE NEXT SESSION.
TO AGREE TO REPORT OF COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE PROPOSING THAT BOTH HOUSES ADJOURN AT 4 O'CLOCK AND 30 MINUTES P.M. SATURDAY, JULY 20, TO MEET AGAIN ON THURSDAY NOVEMBER 21 AT 12 O'CLOCK M.

TO PASS THE RESOLUTION RELATING TO MEMBERS OF THE HOUSE FROM TENNESSEE; REFUSING A SEAT WHILE INVESTIGATION IS IN PROGRESS, AMENDED AS FOLLOWS:  STRIKING OUT ALL AFTER 'RESOLVED' AND INSERTING 'THAT THE CREDENTIALS OF R. R. BUTLER FROM FIRST DISTRICT OF TENNESSEE BE REFERRED TO COMMITTEE ON ELECTIONS AND HE NOT BE SWORN PENDING THE INVESTIGATION.

TO REFER TO COMMITTEE ON ELECTIONS THE CONTESTED ELECTION CASE INVOLVING CERTIFICATE OF ELECTION OF J. S. GOLLADAY FROM STATE OF KENTUCKY AS REPRESENTATIVE TO CONGRESS IN PLACE OF ELIJAH HISE, DECEASED; SAID GOLLADAY NOT BE SWORN PENDING INVESTIGATION.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS A RESOLUTION DECLARING THAT IN THE PRESENT FINANCIAL CONDITION OF THE COUNTRY, ANY FURTHER PURCHASES OF TERRITORY ARE INEXPEDIENT, AND THIS HOUSE WILL HOLD ITSELF UNDER NO OBLIGATION TO VOTE MONEY TO PAY FOR ANY SUCH PURCHASE UNLESS THERE IS GREATER PRESENT NECESSITY FOR THE SAME THAN NOW EXISTS.

TO TABLE A RESOLUTION INSTRUCTING THE COMMITTEE ON BANKING AND CURRENCY TO REPORT AT AN EARLY DAY A BILL PROVIDING FOR WITHDRAWAL FROM CIRCULATION THE NATIONAL CURRENCY AND SUPPLYING IN PLACE TREASURY NOTES, USUALLY KNOWN AS GREENBACKS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND CONSIDER A RESOLUTION ALLOWING NO FURTHER APPROPRIATION OF PUBLIC LANDS TO STATES OR CORPORATIONS FOR THE PURPOSE OF BUILDING RAILROADS, BECAUSE OF PRESENT FINANCIAL CONDITION OF THE COUNTRY; AND PROVIDING THAT ALL SUCH LANDS SHOULD BE HELD FOR PRIVATE SALE, AND ACTUAL SETTLERS, OR FOR HOMESTEADS.

TO TABLE A RESOLUTION RESCINDING THE RESOLUTION OF 3/6/67 RELATIVE TO DRAWING SEATS IN HOUSE AND PROVIDING THAT AFTER PASSAGE OF THIS RESOLUTION THE CLERK OF THE HOUSE WILL PLACE IN A BOX THE NAMES OF EACH MEMBER AND DRAWING THEM OUT ONE BY ONE, HAVE THE MEMBERS SO DRAWN CHOOSE THEIR SEATS; PROVIDED THAT THE CHOSEN SEAT BE VACANT.
TO TABLE A MOTION RECONSIDERING THE VOTE BY WHICH THE DRAWING FOR SEATS RESOLUTION WAS REJECTED.

TO AMEND H. R. 207, (15 STAT 34, FEB. 3, 1868) A BILL PROVIDING FOR EXEMPTION OF COTTON FROM INTERNAL TAX BY STRIKING OUT ALL AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE AND INSERTING IN LIEU THEREOF THE FOLLOWING:  THAT ON AND AFTER THE PASSAGE OF THIS ACT THE INTERNAL REVENUE TAX OF 2 1/2 CENTS PER POUND ON COTTON SHALL BE ABOLISHED; THAT NO AMERICAN MANUFACTURED COTTON GOODS SHALL BE ENTITLED TO BENEFIT OF DRAWBACK UNLESS SHIPPED WITHIN 90 DAYS AFTER PASSAGE OF THIS ACT.
TO AMEND H. R. 207, BY ADDING THE PROVISO THAT COURT OF CLAIMS SHALL NOT HAVE OR ENTERTAIN ANY JURISDICTION OF ANY CLAIM TO COVER BACK ANY TAXES WHICH HAVE BEEN OR MAY BE PAID ON COTTON.
TO PASS H. R. 207.
TO CONCUR WITH THE SENATE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT MEMBERS OF THE JOINT COMMITTEE ON ORDINANCE APPOINTED AT THE LAST SESSION BE, AND ARE HEREBY RE-APPOINTED.

THAT WHEN HOUSE ADJOURNS TODAY, IT ADJOURNS UNTIL MONDAY NEXT, MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION THAT ANDREW JOHNSON, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES, BE IMPEACHED FOR HIGH CRIMES AND MISDEMEANORS.
